input_text:
Job Title: Machining Applications Engineer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Product Management

Description:
Machining Applications Engineer
Are you someone who loves technology and enjoys helping others? If so, our client may have the perfect job for you! They are looking for a full-time Machining Applications Engineer to join their remote team. That's right, you'll get to have your home as a base, while traveling 65% - 75% of the time to various locations, representing the company.
Our client offers a generous salary of $70,000 - $90,000 per year, along with fantastic benefits:
PTODental InsuranceHealth InsuranceA 401(k)
Intrigued? Keep reading to learn more!
QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of experience in the machining background with mutli-axis CNC turning and milling applications5+ years of experience with high temperature alloys 5+ years of experience with tool geometry, as well as Unigraphics NX, and modelingExperience with different process improvements, cost savings, as well as any type of role supporting and troubleshooting with engineersWillingness to travel to different locations 60-70% of the timeBackground in CNC turning and multi-axis milling, utilizing ceramic, carbide, PCD, solid and indexable, cutting tools, and equipmentExperience in Tool geometry, grinding, and EDM experience
A DAY IN THE LIFE
As a Technical Product Specialist, your role is all about innovation and enhancement. You dazzle audiences with captivating introductions and seamless demonstrations of new products, ensuring they're met with excitement and enthusiasm. Beyond the spotlight, you provide unwavering application support, guiding users through the intricacies of our latest offerings with patience and expertise.
But the excitement doesn't stop thereâ€”you also dive into the nitty-gritty of process improvement, meticulously reviewing objectives and specifications to enhance existing applications and workflows. With your dedication to innovation and customer satisfaction, you're at the forefront of driving positive change and ensuring our products exceed expectations at every turn!
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Founded in 1958, our client has become a trusted name in the metalworking and machining industry. Their primary focus is on cost savings programs for their customers, ensuring that they provide exceptional solutions and help their clients achieve their business goals. By leveraging their knowledge and skills, they support aerospace customers with integrated supply solutions that meet their unique needs.
This company fosters a hardworking and collaborative environment, where employees are encouraged to bring their expertise and passion to the table. They value teamwork, open communication, and a strong work ethic. As a job seeker, you can expect to be part of a team that is driven, supportive, and focused on delivering exceptional results!
APPLY NOW
If you think this job aligns with your requirements, then applying is simple. You can complete the initial application in about three minutes. Good luck!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Machining Applications Engineer
output_json.summary: Full-time position requiring extensive experience in machining, including multi-axis CNC turning and milling applications, high temperature alloys, tool geometry, Unigraphics NX, and modeling.
output_json.company_information: Founded in 1958, the company specializes in cost savings programs for customers in the metalworking and machining industry, focusing on aerospace customers with integrated supply solutions.
